pr_title: Fix PreFetch annotation in ZkClient and CallbackHandler

timeline.message: Fix PreFetch annotation in ZkClient and CallbackHandler

timeline.bodyText: Can we add more description here, such as if this is disabled, in the ZkClient's callback handleDataChange(Path, Data), you should expect the data is null.  Also, mention what is the default value if not set.
timeline.author: lei-xia
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -22,8 +22,19 @@ import java.lang.annotation.Retention; import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy; - +/** + * An annotation used to prefetch changed data for + * {@link org.apache.helix.zookeeper.zkclient.IZkDataListener} in ZkClient. + *

+ * Example: + * 

+ * {@code @PreFetch(enabled = false)}
+ *  public class MyCallback implements IZkDataListener
+ *
+ * {@code @PreFetch(enabled = false)} means data will not be prefetched in ZkClient before + * handling data change. + */

timeline.bodyText: By default, prefetch is enabled or disabled? Line 28 and 31 are conflict.
timeline.author: lei-xia
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -22,8 +22,25 @@
 import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
 import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
 
-
+/**
+ * An annotation used to prefetch changed data for
+ * {@link org.apache.helix.zookeeper.zkclient.IZkDataListener} in ZkClient.
+ * By default, prefetch is enabled: when ZkClient handles a data change event,
+ * ZkClient will read data and pass data object to
+ * {@link org.apache.helix.zookeeper.zkclient.IZkDataListener#handleDataChange(String, Object)}.
+ * By default, prefetch is disabled: ZkClient will not read data, so data object is passed as null.

replies.bodyText: I don't know how I wrote two conflicting sentences @____@ Addressed.
replies.author: huizhilu

timeline.bodyText: What is the use for this @retention ?
timeline.author: kaisun2000
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -22,8 +22,25 @@ import java.lang.annotation.Retention; import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy; - +/** + * An annotation used to prefetch changed data for + * {@link org.apache.helix.zookeeper.zkclient.IZkDataListener} in ZkClient. + * By default, prefetch is enabled: when ZkClient handles a data change event, + * ZkClient will read data and pass data object to + * {@link org.apache.helix.zookeeper.zkclient.IZkDataListener#handleDataChange(String, Object)}. + * If disabled({@code false}): ZkClient will not read data, so data object is passed as null. + *

+ * Example: + * 

+ * {@code @PreFetch(enabled = false)}
+ *  public class MyCallback implements IZkDataListener
+ *
+ * + * {@code @PreFetch(enabled = false)} means data will not be prefetched in ZkClient before + * handling data change: data is null in + * {@link org.apache.helix.zookeeper.zkclient.IZkDataListener#handleDataChange(String, Object)} + */ @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)

replies.bodyText: @kaisun2000  It tells the Java compiler and JVM that the annotation should be available via reflection at runtime/class/source code. More details you could check jdk javadoc.
replies.author: huizhilu

replies.bodyText: Right, is it a must here? I don't see we have something like this in other places, say participant side?
replies.author: kaisun2000

replies.bodyText: By the way, just to confirm. After this fix, PreFetchChangeData is used to ZKClient? How about prefetch, who is using it? can you add comment here?
replies.author: kaisun2000

replies.bodyText: Prefetch is Helix's logic, should not be involved here in zkClient. The javadoc should stay in that interface, not this one.
replies.author: huizhilu

timeline.bodyText: Previously (in production) callbackhandler not using prefetch, do we verify?
timeline.author: kaisun2000

timeline.bodyText:
3L is 3 milli second? This can be a source of test unstableness. Let us try 3 second. Using 3 second does not really mean you will wait 3 second anyway.
nit: Also, define the waiting period using a constant static.
timeline.author: kaisun2000

replies.bodyText:
Cool. Due to recent fixing unstable test, this is getting to be a habit to look for unstableness.
Let us define a constant of this waiting for both test cases. Otherwise, looks good to me.
replies.author: kaisun2000
